Quick Start (Rust)

Build blazing-fast web applications with PhilJS and Rust. Compile to WebAssembly for near-native performance.

i

Prerequisites

Make sure you have Rust 1.75+ installed. Run rustup update to get the latest version. You'll also need the wasm32-unknown-unknown target: rustup target add wasm32-unknown-unknown

Install cargo-philjs

Terminal
$cargo install cargo-philjs

Create a New Project

Terminal
$cargo philjs new my-app
$cd my-app
$cargo philjs dev

Open http://localhost:3000 to see your app running.

Project Structure

my-app/
├── src/
│   ├── lib.rs              # App entry point
│   ├── app.rs              # Main App component
│   ├── components/
│   │   ├── mod.rs
│   │   └── counter.rs      # Example component
│   └── routes/
│       ├── mod.rs
│       └── home.rs         # Home page
├── public/
│   └── index.html
├── Cargo.toml
└── PhilJS.toml             # PhilJS configuration

The view! Macro

PhilJS Rust uses the view! macro for declarative UI. It looks similar to HTML but with Rust expressions:

src/components/counter.rsrust
1use philjs::prelude::*;
2 
3#[component]
4fn Counter() -> Element {
5    let count = use_signal(|| 0);
6 
7    view! {
8        <div class="counter">
9            <h1>"Count: " {count}</h1>
10            <button on:click=move |_| count.set(|c| c + 1)>
11                "Increment"
12            </button>
13        </div>
14    }
15}

Key Differences from JSX

  • Strings must be quoted: Use "text" instead of bare text
  • Use class: Not className
  • Event handlers: Use on:click syntax
  • Expressions: Wrap Rust expressions in {}

Signals in Rust

Signals work similarly to TypeScript, but with Rust's ownership semantics:

src/components/signals_example.rsrust
1use philjs::prelude::*;
2 
3#[component]
4fn SignalsExample() -> Element {
5    // Create a signal - Clone is automatic
6    let count = use_signal(|| 0);
7 
8    // Computed values with use_memo
9    let doubled = use_memo(move || count() * 2);
10    let is_even = use_memo(move || count() % 2 == 0);
11 
12    // Side effects
13    use_effect(move || {
14        log::info!("Count changed to: {}", count());
15 
16        // Cleanup (optional)
17        on_cleanup(|| {
18            log::info!("Cleaning up...");
19        });
20    });
21 
22    view! {
23        <div>
24            <p>"Count: " {count}</p>
25            <p>"Doubled: " {doubled}</p>
26            <p>"Is Even: " {move || if is_even() { "Yes" } else { "No" }}</p>
27            <button on:click=move |_| count.set(|c| c + 1)>"+1"</button>
28        </div>
29    }
30}

Rendering Lists

Use the For component for efficient list rendering:

src/components/todo_list.rsrust
1use philjs::prelude::*;
2 
3#[derive(Clone, PartialEq)]
4struct Todo {
5    id: u32,
6    text: String,
7    done: bool,
8}
9 
10#[component]
11fn TodoList() -> Element {
12    let todos = use_signal(|| vec![
13        Todo { id: 1, text: "Learn Rust".into(), done: true },
14        Todo { id: 2, text: "Build with PhilJS".into(), done: false },
15    ]);
16 
17    let add_todo = move |text: String| {
18        todos.update(|t| t.push(Todo {
19            id: t.len() as u32 + 1,
20            text,
21            done: false,
22        }));
23    };
24 
25    view! {
26        <ul class="space-y-2">
27            <For
28                each=move || todos()
29                key=|todo| todo.id
30                children=|todo| view! {
31                    <li class="flex items-center gap-2">
32                        <input
33                            type="checkbox"
34                            prop:checked=todo.done
35                        />
36                        <span class=("line-through", todo.done)>
37                            {todo.text}
38                        </span>
39                    </li>
40                }
41            />
42        </ul>
43    }
44}

Async Data Fetching

Use use_resource for async data:

src/components/user_profile.rsrust
1use philjs::prelude::*;
2use serde::Deserialize;
3 
4#[derive(Clone, Deserialize)]
5struct User {
6    id: u32,
7    name: String,
8    email: String,
9}
10 
11#[component]
12fn UserProfile() -> Element {
13    let user_id = use_signal(|| 1u32);
14 
15    let user = use_resource(move || async move {
16        let url = format!(
17            "https://api.example.com/users/{}",
18            user_id()
19        );
20        reqwest::get(&url)
21            .await?
22            .json::<User>()
23            .await
24    });
25 
26    view! {
27        <div>
28            <Suspense fallback=|| view! { <p>"Loading..."</p> }>
29                {move || user.read().map(|result| {
30                    match result {
31                        Ok(u) => view! {
32                            <div>
33                                <h2>{u.name.clone()}</h2>
34                                <p>{u.email.clone()}</p>
35                            </div>
36                        },
37                        Err(e) => view! {
38                            <p class="text-red-500">
39                                "Error: " {e.to_string()}
40                            </p>
41                        },
42                    }
43                })}
44            </Suspense>
45        </div>
46    }
47}

Server Functions

Call Rust functions on the server directly from your components:

src/routes/user.rsrust
1use philjs::prelude::*;
2 
3// This function runs on the server
4#[server]
5async fn get_user(id: u32) -> Result<User, ServerError> {
6    // Database access, file I/O, etc.
7    let user = db::get_user(id).await?;
8    Ok(user)
9}
10 
11#[server]
12async fn create_todo(text: String) -> Result<Todo, ServerError> {
13    let todo = db::create_todo(&text).await?;
14    Ok(todo)
15}
16 
17#[component]
18fn UserPage() -> Element {
19    let user_id = use_params::<u32>();
20 
21    // Call server function from client
22    let user = use_resource(move || get_user(user_id()));
23 
24    view! {
25        <Suspense fallback=|| view! { <LoadingSkeleton /> }>
26            {move || user.read().map(|result| {
27                result.map(|u| view! {
28                    <UserCard user=u />
29                })
30            })}
31        </Suspense>
32    }
33}

Building for Production

Terminal
$# Build optimized WASM binary
$cargo philjs build --release
$
$# Output is in dist/
$ls dist/

The build output includes optimized WASM, JavaScript glue code, and your static assets. Deploy to any static hosting provider.
